thread.title: South Korea says believes North Korean regime involved in Kim Jong Nam murder - Channel NewsAsia
thread.title_full: South Korea says believes North Korean regime involved in Kim Jong Nam murder - Channel NewsAsia

title: South Korea says believes North Korean regime involved in Kim Jong Nam murder - Channel NewsAsia
text:
Asia Pacific South Korea says believes North Korean regime involved in Kim Jong Nam murder South Korea said on Sunday it believed the North Korean regime was behind the murder of the estranged half brother of North Korean leader Kim Jong Un. Posted 19 Feb 2017 17:10 People at a railway station in Seoul watch a television news report on the death of Kim Jong-Nam, the half-brother of North Korean leader Kim Jong-Un on February 14, 2017 AFP/JUNG Yeon-Je A 
SEOUL: South Korea said on Sunday it believed the North Korean regime was behind the murder of the estranged half brother of North Korean leader Kim Jong Un. 
"We believe the North Korean regime is behind this incident considering five suspects are North Koreans" Jeong Joon-hee, spokesman at the South Korea's Unification Ministry that handles inter-Korea affairs, told a briefing. 
But Jeong declined to give further information. 
Malaysia police said earlier that they had arrested a North Korean man in connection to the murder of Kim Jong Nam, but four other North Korean suspects fled Malaysia. (Reporting by Ju-min Park and Jack Kim; Editing by Himani Sarkar) - Reuters/nc
